newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU to send North Korea massive food aid.
newsitem.headline: EU to send North Korea massive food aid.

text.p: The European Commission said on Friday it was launching a massive food aid package to help victims of widespread famine in North Korea.

The aid, worth 46.3 million ecus ($53.2 million), consists of 155,000 tonnes of food products, notably rice, maize and vegetable oils, and will be distributed through the U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) and independent aid agencies.
"It's humanitarian aid and non-political," a Commission spokesman said, adding that the EU's executive had had no direct contact with the North Korean authorities.
The aid follows a WFP appeal in April for some 200,000 tonnes of food aid for North Korea.
The EU's executive said in a statement that the aid should also help to avert a possible deterioration in security in the Korean peninsula.
"The EU's approach has not changed," the spokesman added.
The EU supports proposed four-way peace talks between North Korea, the Republic of Korea, the United States and China.
"Such four-party talks are the way to promote lasting peace and stability in the Korean peninsula," the statement said.
North Korea has suffered mounting food shortages due to serious flooding in 1995 and 1996, the absence of economic reforms and alienation of small farmers.
The U.N. Food and Agriculture Organisation has estimated North Korea's food import needs at 2.36 million tonnes, of which only 500,000 tonnes could be imported commercially.
The EU has already provided some 10 million ecus of food aid to North Korea. ($1 = 0.87 ecu)
